Posts.Content: Freedomchild82 wrote: This is not a happy blog, but if you love me, my kids or my husband, or care even a little, please read it. Please share it... Please...  Pray about it... Please... well I don't know what to ask you to do with it... But, We need the kind of prayers, advice and help that I do not even begin to know how or where to ask for it. We need a miracle.... allisonscancerjourney.org/…/2015/01/01/what-do-we-do/ There is a reason for everything. Even This. IDC, Stage 4, Grade 3, Triple Negative. Diagnosed October, 2013. Posts.Title: 2nd Chemo Infusion Yesterday Freedomchild82 del4

Posts.Content: Freedomchild82 wrote: I am in the hospital and have been stuck here since Sunday. I came in because I was sick with several different things and am still here because of very high liver enzymes as well as extremely high levels of Iron. I have no clue what either of those mean but the liver doctor and oncologist seem very concerned about it. I wrote about being in the hospital the last two entries of my personal blog... if you are interested in reading it. I am a little bit frustrated by all this since I have only had 1 Chemo treatment and was told today they can't give me another until they get both the liver and Iron labs into normal numbers. :-/ If the Chemo caused this they will have to change Chemos and it's just to early to already have to scratch two Chemo treatments off the list. I am staying positive but I have to admit I am concerned. Anyone else get high liver enzymes or high iron after first dose of Chemo? Here is my blog link if you want to read about it. Check out my blog for more information about it. www.allisonscancerjourney.org/blog There is a reason for everything. Even This. IDC, Stage 4, Grade 3, Triple Negative. Diagnosed October, 2013. Dx 10/1/2013, IDC, 3cm, Stage IV, Grade 3, mets, ER-/PR-, HER2- Chemotherapy 10/30/2013 Carboplatin (Paraplatin), Taxol (paclitaxel) Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Too Early For This Freedomchild82 bhd1

Posts.Content: Freedomchild82 wrote: On Dec 13, 2013, I became a College graduate. :-) I walked across that stage and it was an amazing feeling. The Dean hugged me after shaking my hand and whispered how very happy she was to see me and see that I was able to walk across on my own. The night was very emotional but it is one I will never forget. I wrote a blog about my life and the path that I had to take in order to finally get my degree. It is quite long, but feel free to read it if you wish. At the end of the blog I posted a picture from graduation night. allisonscancerjourney.org/blog... e-graduation/ I cannot believe I finally did it. :-) There is a reason for everything. Even This. IDC, Stage 4, Grade 3, Triple Negative. Diagnosed October, 2013. Posts.Title: Things I've Learned Freedomchild82 Freedomchild82

Posts.Content: Freedomchild82 wrote: I was diagnosed on October 1st with Breast cancer... after a long fight with my doctor to even get tests done because of a swollen Lymph node I had. (I wrote about it my profile area)... The biopsy was of both the mass in my breast and a nearby Lymph node, so right away we knew it had already spread to the Lymph nodes... I was diagnosed as Invasive ductal.. grade 3.. spread to lymph nodes. After a bone Scan, MRI and pet Scan, they called it stage 4 spread to the bones. I don't get the official biopsy of the bone until Tuesday the 29th but they are 99% sure it's in the bone because of those 3 test results... I start Chemo on the 31st. It's been a long month. I am scared, mad and just in shock. I started a website and blog right away when diagnosed because I want to document the journey for others but sometimes feel I can't fully express my feelings there because my family reads it and I don't want to upset them. I have joined one other online community but felt another one or two couldn't hurt. We all need as much support as we can get. My website is allisonscancerjourney.org and it includes a link to my blog if anyone wants to know more about story and journey so far. There is a reason for everything. Even This. IDC, Stage 4, Grade 3, Triple Negative. Diagnosed October, 2013.
